intro: Sorocephalus intermedius, commonly known as the intermediate sorocephalus, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and saline conditions. Its leaves are finely divided and have a mild, aromatic scent. Sorocephalus intermedius is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique ecological adaptations and potential medicinal properties.
